items.sentence: That woman standing over there is my mother.
Somebody broke into Tom's office last night.
Tom must've thought Mary could speak French.
It's your own fault that that didn't happen.
Are both Tom and Mary still studying French?
Are your children able to speak French, too?
Tom and Mary are both still studying French.
I don't think I need to explain that to Tom.
I don't think I have to explain that to Tom.
Tom told me that Mary couldn't speak French.
Tom told me I should go to Boston with Mary.
Tom told me he'd like to visit us in Boston.
Tom said that he thought Mary taught French.
Tom said that he heard Mary speaking French.
Tom hung his wet clothes on the clothesline.
Tom hasn't done as much as you think he has.
Tom has run this restaurant for three years.
Tom has been in Boston visiting his parents.
I wish I hadn't borrowed this book from Tom.
I haven't heard from Tom since last October.
